pros: Cushioned for long miles; Supportive for a neutral shoe; Wide platform; Secure foothold; Well-padded interiors; Highly breathable; Great for casual wear; Value for money; True to size

RR_verdict: The Adidas Adistar 2.0 is a neutral daily trainer on steroids. We could easily mistake it for a stability shoe if we wore it with our eyes closed. It's got a well-cushioned, wide, and supportive platform which, in our opinion, works best for those easy recovery days. If we look past its disturbingly heavy setup, we can claim the Adistar 2.0 as a solid daily running option.
awards: Top pick in best running shoes for plantar fasciitis (2023), Top pick in best running shoes with a wide toebox (2023)
